message_1: Given the key matrix K = $\begin{bmatrix} 3 & 2\\ 5 & 7 \end{bmatrix}$, and a plaintext message "HELLO", convert it to uppercase letters and apply Hill Cipher encryption. Show the resulting ciphertext.
message_2:
To apply the Hill Cipher encryption, we first need to convert the plaintext message "HELLO" into numerical values using the alphabetical index (A=0, B=1, ..., Z=25). Since the given key matrix K is a 2x2 matrix, we need to break the plaintext into pairs of letters. If the plaintext has an odd number of characters, we can add an extra letter (usually 'X') to make it even. In this case, the plaintext is already even, so we don't need to add any extra letters.

Plaintext: HELLO
Numerical representation: H=7, E=4, L=11, L=11, O=14

Now, we need to arrange these numerical values into a 2x1 matrix and multiply it with the key matrix K.

First pair: HE
$\begin{bmatrix} 3 & 2\\ 5 & 7 \end{bmatrix}$ x $\begin{bmatrix} 7\\ 4 \end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix} 3(7) + 2(4)\\ 5(7) + 7(4) \end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix} 21 + 8\\ 35 + 28 \end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix} 29\\ 63 \end{bmatrix}$

Now, we need to take the result modulo 26 to get the numerical values of the ciphertext.
$\begin{bmatrix} 29\\ 63 \end{bmatrix}$ mod 26 = $\begin{bmatrix} 3\\ 11 \end{bmatrix}$

The numerical values 3 and 11 correspond to the letters D and L, respectively.

Second pair: LL
$\begin{bmatrix} 3 & 2\\ 5 & 7 \end{bmatrix}$ x $\begin{bmatrix} 11\\ 11 \end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix} 3(11) + 2(11)\\ 5(11) + 7(11) \end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix} 33 + 22\\ 55 + 77 \end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix} 55\\ 132 \end{bmatrix}$

Now, we need to take the result modulo 26 to get the numerical values of the ciphertext.
$\begin{bmatrix} 55\\ 132 \end{bmatrix}$ mod 26 = $\begin{bmatrix} 3\\ 4 \end{bmatrix}$

The numerical values 3 and 4 correspond to the letters D and E, respectively.

Third pair: LO
$\begin{bmatrix} 3 & 2\\ 5 & 7 \end{bmatrix}$ x $\begin{bmatrix} 11\\ 14 \end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix} 3(11) + 2(14)\\ 5(11) + 7(14) \end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix} 33 + 28\\ 55 + 98 \end{bmatrix}$ = $\begin{bmatrix} 61\\ 153 \end{bmatrix}$

Now, we need to take the result modulo 26 to get the numerical values of the ciphertext.
$\begin{bmatrix} 61\\ 153 \end{bmatrix}$ mod 26 = $\begin{bmatrix} 9\\ 5 \end{bmatrix}$

The numerical values 9 and 5 correspond to the letters J and F, respectively.

So, the resulting ciphertext for the plaintext "HELLO" is "DLDEJF".
